page.title: 17LONG DISTANCE WALKER.
page.content: Mr. Roger Frear, a teacher at Blackfield First School, spent the summer of 1985 on unpaid leave walking across Australia to raise money for two local charities and his school. The Australian people proved friendly and helpful, unlike some Americans he had met across America some years previous, when he had needed to arm himself for protection. In Australia, apart from the continual problem of having to carry his own water, the main difficulty occurred when a badly infectrd foot necessitated several days in a hospital bed, unable to walk and uncertain whether he would meet his deadline of the new school term. He made it and is now wondering what 1986 might have in store.
